{{cpp/title|range_format}}
{{cpp/utility/format/navbar}}
{{ddcl|header=format|since=c++23|1=
enum class range_format {
    disabled,
    map,
    set,
    sequence,
    string,
    debug_string
};
}}

Specifies how a range should be formatted.

===Constants===
{{dsc begin}}
{{dsc hitem|Name|Explanation}}
{{dsc|{{tt|disabled}}|disallows range default formatter to format range}}

{{dsc|{{tt|map}}|allows to format range as map representation with modified brackets {{c|"{"}}, {{c|"}"}} and separator {{c|": "}} for underlying {{lt|cpp/utility/tuple/tuple-like|''pair-like''}} types in the following format:&lt;br&gt;{ {{spar|key-1}} : {{spar|value-1}}, ..., {{spar|key-n}} : {{spar|value-n}} }
}}

{{dsc|{{tt|set}}|allows to format range as set representation with modified brackets {{c|"{"}} and {{c|"}"}} in the following format:&lt;br&gt;{ {{spar|key-1}}, ..., {{spar|key-n}} }
}}

{{dsc|{{tt|sequence}}|allows to format range as sequence representation with default brackets {{c|"["}}, {{c|"]"}} and separator {{c|", "}} in the following format:&lt;br&gt;[ {{spar|element-1}}, ..., {{spar|element-n}} ]
}}

{{dsc|{{tt|string}}|allows to format range as string}}

{{dsc|{{tt|debug_string}}|allows to format range as escaped string}}
{{dsc end}}
